reviewText:
I've played 30 minutes for now. I'll try to put my early impressions into words: The game has an heavily russian community (Thanks god I'm used to CSGO already) but anyways.

The graphics are outdated but not too bad with 8x AA. The combat is somewhat great it's comparable to TERA which is a great thing, but it's unresponsive. You just spam left click and you don't get any feedback (In form of audio or shaking).

Also the physics are sooo bad. I have to get a 'Magic Seed' and climb a tree and I just feel off because I tried to climb it and umm died.


I won't say it doesn't have potential but there are way better alternatives out there.

reviewText:
I like this game quite a bit, there are much better MMORPG's with the same non target style but you don't come across as many as you think. Some pros are:
- The Aforementioned action style combat rather than tab-targeting system
- There is item enhancement and auction house (ala Archeage, WoW, etc)
- The PVP aspect of the game (May be a problem for many people but that's why the PVE server was made)
- There are quite a bit of classes to choose from (gender locked with certain races like demon gets top and bottom male and middle female, and humans get top and bottom female and middle male, so it sort of evens out.
- Quite a good amount of people for a slightly new MMO
- The skills are a bit less then most MMO's but they are easy to get as you can get most in about 3-5 hrs
- Enemy's are fun to fight and the game is quite difficult (depending on the class you choose
- You don't have to grind much unless your going for lvl 40 (good luck) really quickly
- PVP is great due to the aforementioned action style combat
- The download isn't so much so great to try out for a bit
Even thought I say it's a good game, it's got quite a bit of cons
- Graphics are not as good as most new MMO's (I don't care but some people do)
- High lvls can spam kill newbies depending on their moral compass
- The server is pretty stable but I ran into a few server glitches and some 10 second disconnects because of the server
-  I ran into a few bugs ( one including when I started the game Fluffy got stuck inside the wood of a carriage) but not that many
- Some spelling and grammatical errors
- Many things you can buy but not Pay2Win" (Mostly cosmetics and mounts but there are weapons.
I like this game and I am still playing it
date: as long as my internet holds up :(. I seriously recommend you play this with a friend because you can team against bosses and dungeons
hoursPlayed: and you will run into many pvpers on your journey so having more than one person will usually grant you your win
voteText: or intimidate your opponent. I recommend it and I will hope to see you out there :)"

reviewText:
Sphere III: Enchanted World is a pretty average MMO all around. The graphics are dated, but it has pseudo-action combat for those curious, you target with a crosshair and use left and right mouse to use primary abilitys (that you set) and then the number keys as ability keys like MMO standard.

To go into a little more detail, character creation begins with race and class selections, there are 4 playable races to choose, dwarf, human, elf, and demon. Currently only humans and demons are selectable. I am not sure if elves and dwarves are locked because they are unfinished and unimplemented yet, or if they are some sort of bonus you get for something. Class wise there are 9 that I remember, the classes are gender locked. The 9 classes are Barbarian, paladin, warrior, ranger, monk, assassin, sorcerer, priest and necromancer.

Currently I am leveling an Assassin, so far throughout the demon starting zone my experience has been solid, dated, but definitely decent.  Overall I feel that Sphere 3: enchanted world does not do very much different from MMO's that were out 5- 10 years ago. It does however manage to keep what made many of those MMOs decent. I would recommend it to anyone who is a fan of classic MMO's

reviewText:
The game has potential, but there are several nuisances that bother me. It feels cumbersome to play.

Things I like:
- 9 classes to pick from. Several look interesting.
- Graphics are fine.

Things I dont like:
- 2 of the 4 races are inavailable, with no explanation at all.
- Cant choose gender.
- Secveral keyboard keys cant be mapped, including shift and enter.
- Jumping doesnt work very well. To jump over a fence you have to run towards it and then jump. Otherwise you'll just jump into the air at the same spot. Jumping over gaps or up cliffs is awful.
- No run/walk control. Takes forever to get places.
- No loot except quest items and a few coins.
- Spell casting is awkward. The game doesnt detect whether you'll hit anything, so it doesnt tell you if the target is out of range or anything. Sometimes I don't understand why nothing happens when I cast at someone.
- After killing something you have to wait for the loot to be interactable.
- Map cant be zoomed in much, so it only works as a world overview.
- There are no audial or visual effects that warn you that you are taking damage.

reviewText: I've been gaming for over 30 years. This is probably THE worst mmorpg I've ever played. The graphics are early 2000's at best. Quests are ridiculously long and way too spread out and you only get a TEMPORARY mount for like, a day.  It takes longer to level in this game than ANY other I've ever played. The non targeting system completely sucks. I always make my main a healer and when you're trying to heal your tank, but you can't lock on to him and he's bouncing all over the place...I think I *actually* healed a mob. >.< Save yourself the trouble. This game blows. One of the better FTP MMORPG's that I played for years is Shaiya. I was explaining to one of my kids that Sphere III is like if Shaiya had a mentally challenged little brother. Soooo, yeah. I'm gonna give it another day ir two, but I don't see me wasting much more time on it. Somebody spread some love and get me a REAL mmorpg off my wishlist! <3 ;)

reviewText:
IntroductionTake a journey to an epic fantasy world of Sphere 3: Enchanted World, the PvP-based MMORPG with hardcore non-target system! Play it for free to experience massive battles, breathtaking castle sages, deep storyline and even more.
https://youtu.be/PP83A1yXe9g
CommentsClasses are gender locked. This is not really a big deal to me, but it may bother some who abhor not having a choice of gender for each class. There are several classes to choose from: Paladin, barbarian, Warrior, Ranger, Monk, Assassin, Sorcerer, Priest, and Necromancer. Each has its own strengths and weaknesses.

Character customization is limited by the gender lock feature, but several different hairstyles, colors, eyes, and tattoos are available. Races include Humans, Elves, Demons, and Dwarves. Humans and Demons are the only two available upon first entry into the game, the other two are locked for new players.

Story: well thought out. If you like quests, this game has over 1000 of them! For those willing to put in the time, multitudes of content are readily available for your experience.

Quests can be repetitive: kill “x amount of things” or collect “x amount of other things.” However, this is typical in almost all MMOs. Quests will vary.

Art style looks old but has a surprising amount of detail put into the environment. Skill animations are simple and not too flashy, but get the job done.

No voice acting for NPCs, usually only 1 option for dialogue when talking to NPCs. If you like reading text more than listening to voices; this may be a welcome addition to you. However, if you hate reading text and prefer listening to voice acting, you may have a hard time with this game.

Combat system is slow; attacks are delayed by 2-3 seconds. Definitely requires patience and persistence in order to be successful. Along with this, enemy AI is extremely buggy.

There are multitudes of skills to learn, each unique to their respective classes. Upgrade and enchant your weapons and armor, find legendary loot, fight epic monsters, and have a fun time traveling around the vast world.

Content: hundreds of hours of it if you are willing to spend the time. Story is fully narrated. This game has an endless amount of quests and places to explore. There are Pve servers for more casual players and PvP servers for those who wish to be competitive.

Client can be glitchy at times, closing with no warning or freezing. This has only happened to me a few times when on the loading screen, but not while in-game. I just thought I would point that out.

Camera: 3rd person, but if you zoom in enough, you can transition to first person. Cursor automatically moves camera, you can press tab to use your cursor regularly. No problems here, the camera does it's job very well.

FREE! The only thing you would potentially lose in this game if you ended up not liking it is time. The download and requirements are not that big either, so what's stopping you from trying this game out?
Final overviewThere are a few minor flaws associated with this game. This game has a potential for an amazing and immersive experience. Much has been put into this game, and I like what it has to offer; hours of questing (with some grinding), dungeons to conquer, and varieties of classes, skills, and equipment.
Download and try it out now!

Verdict: 6.5/10
Review done for Vantom Giveaways.
Read the review on our {LINK REMOVED}website.

reviewText:
It's a pretty good game, but has room for improvement

Pros:

Action combat with actual hit detection

Pretty graphics, and they run quite well on low-mid range systems(getting 180 fps maxed out 1080P on an i5 and a Radeon HD 7870. I could probably get 60 fps in 4K if I had a 4K monitor.

Catchy soundtrack

Cons:

-Generic MMO at the start with quests, kill x of a certain monster, talk to this guy, etc.

- Game needs more polish, feels a bit unfinished.



I have not reached endgame yet so I can't comment on that, will update my review as I get further

reviewText:
One of the best MMORPGs i've played so far, even just behind World of Warcraft!
The action-based combat system feels responsive, the graphics are nothing short
of stunningly beautiful and the interface is extremely easy to navigate.

The only things i believe should be fixed/added is:
- Zooming in/out appears to be inverted, which takes some time to get used to,
- It gets kinda annoying when your mounted, and you accidentally click with your mouse, causing you to dismount,
- Speaking of mounts, they should be bought in game via ingame currency at level 20 or atleast 30, and make the
vanity shop only sell special mounts.
- There should be an option to decrease the particle effects ingame, because some of us do or may experience
frame drops in places where there's too much smoke/fire...

Overall, if your looking for an action-oriented MMORPG that doesn't require a bohemoth to run, then this is for you!

reviewerDisplayName: Ryuu ga waga teki wo kurau
reviewText:
I'm gonna keep this short and sweet and outline the pros and cons of this game:

+Great environment, scenery and music
+Non tab-target combat
+Easy to run - very accessible for people with older rigs
+Good clean UI - very user friendly
+9 different classes to choose from
+Open-world PvP

-Currently only 2 playable races which have gender locked classes
-Outdated graphics and animations might be offputting for some people
-Traditional fetch, kill and loot quests
-Character customisation is limited

Now, I will be updating this review as I play more of the game but so far I'm liking what I see. The main downside to this game is that you'll have to be an old-school MMORPG player to really appreciate the game (WoW Vanilla, EQ era). I think the game has potential, and the positives mostly outweigh the negatives. Outdated graphics don't bother me and the combat is pretty satisfying and you have plenty of skills to choose from. Questing is typical of an MMO which is something I've gotten used to. Art direction is great and there's some really nice looking areas. Hopefully they'll remove gender locked classes and polish animations and stuff like that in the future.

I wouldn't listen to all the hate the game gets until you try it out for yourself, and you'll most likely enjoy this game if you're a hardcore MMO fan.

reviewText:
Eai pessoal aqui é o goha do canal pug and play e dei uma olhada neste jogo, vou deixar minha opinião abaixo sobre o jogo, mas quem quiser ver o video completo da minha primeira impressão segue o link : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cmz8a7Gtexo

Este jogo é mais um mmorpg free que não muda muito a fórmula básica de um MMO. Esta frase basicamente resume este jogo, abaixo segue minha impressão inicial:

- Existem poucas opções de customizações do personagem e poucas raças liberadas.
- O jogo não facilita nem um pouco a fechar as quests, te obrigando a andar até o local da quest e depois andar de volta para quem te deu a quest para termina-la, não fornecendo nenhum sistema para poupar seu tempo.
- O gráfico é bem simples e as opções que o jogo oferece ao jogador de jogabilidade se limitam muito a de um mmoorpg básico.
-O combate é bem parecido com TERA, aonde você pode lançar seus ataques/magias e eles percorrem uma distância pré-determinada.
- As animações de ataque e do personagem são bem básicas também.

Por fim não recomendo muito este jogo, considerando que vivemos um momento que existem tantos mmorpgs no mercado, além de vários que prometem sererem muito bons prestes a sair. Com isso este jogo não me chamou atenção com os elementos que observei ao joga-lo um pouco.

reviewText:
It's free, might as well give it a shot.

The combat system is a bit different from a lot of traditional MMOs, but it's not bad. No performance issues even on my horrible pc.
There are some minor bugs I've encountered (Like there's been a text stuck on my screen for around 2 hours), I don't like the way they handled climbing up steep hills and the translation isn't perfect. Despite all this I'd recommend it, it can be quite fun if you don't hate grindy quests. But let's be real, if you did, why would you want to play an MMO?

Protip: If you don't want to go mad turn off the music, every time you accidentally left/right-click you'll get in combat and the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ music will start playing.

reviewText:
This game is truly something new and original. It brings much more to MMORPG genre, then most of the popular MMORPGs since WoW.
This game is not about core classic MMORPG mechanics - such as doing quests, grinding mobs and passing through dungeons. If it's what you like about MMOs - this is not the right game for you.
The most important thing about S3 - is PvP and metagame, connected with it! Grinding mobs? Suddenly demon attacks - and you're dead and lost some of your money to attacker. Trying to make it to teleport - and you're dead again. On a third try carefully, stealthly crawling to teleport through jungle. Demon saw you, but you were quicker - and you're in human city, asking for help against demon. Now you're back in area with some high-lvls helpers. They're killing demon a couple of times, getting all gold back. Then you're on revenge expedition to demon lands.
In this game you don't lvlup for nothing, you lvlup to survive. And when you kill your first demon/human in an honest PVP fight - this is an achievement to charish and remember.

This game - probably unintentionally - offers something, that no other MMO has - awesome metagame with hardcore PvP. This game is not about graphics or doing quests - it's about survival, friendship and rivalry.

Totally recommend to mature hardcore games, who tired of standard wow-clone mmo experience, and wants some new and unique experience.

reviewText:
If you are mmorpg player and started playing in mid 2000 games like Lineage 2 c1 or Kalonline you feel here like at home. This game is PvP oriented with alot of grind for exp. At lower lvls around till 20 there are alot of quest which are generic kill and loot stuf. Later quest will end and you will have to grind on mobs to level up and get around new 10-15 quest which give you 1/3 exp of your current lvl and than you grind again to next lvl. Every class have capability to solo AoE grind, some classes are better in that case. I think best way to level up is AoE grind after lvl 20 becouse later it takes you 30min to complete 1 quest which gives you 10k exp and you can get that much amount in 2min with AoE on mobs.

Pros:
There is solo pve arena where you have to defeat waves of mobs. Total 45 waves
Dungeons and World bosses
Good optimized game runs on any toaster like 10 years old rig
There are castles where clan control it which gives good rewards for clan members
Non target combat system
PvP (with PK system) and PvE server

Cons:
Gender locked classes
Low population atleast on pve server demon side
Server lag
Game feels unfinished alot basic things are missing and need improvement. For things like UI, chat, AH, no friendlist yet
Jumping is awkward
Brainless grind on mobs to level up
NO skill reset for gold, be carefull with your build if you mess up it can cost around 30$ to reset

Is this game P2W? At current state i would say no but there is possible to upgrade your weapon and armor pieces +20 which IS impossible without spending ridiculious ammounts of money and i dont need your theory that if you have milions of gold and thousands of upgrade scrolls you may success. As free to play player you wont get above +10 on weapon or armor becouse even +7 is hard enought to enchant or upgrade. For future my suggesion would be make max upgrade +15 so gap between wallet warriors and freeloaders wont be so high.

I recommend this game to players only which are expierenced with mmorpg and dont mind brainless grind and like pvp. This game wont hold your hand, you have to solo alot which can be tedious unless you start playing with few friends. Also if you die you lose exp and your gear lose durability which cost quite abit gold to repair
If you are casual or new to mmorpg genre i would suggest playing something else there are better alternatives

Im still playing this game while i do see potential and with more people those castle sieges and dungeons could be fun

I rate for now 6/10 will update later

UPDATE 04.01.2016

Not playing anymore reasons: game bugs, problems with server, random dc, game keeps crashing. Most important thing game is ghost town feels like playing a bad single player game where you spend 8 hours everyday killing same type of monster on same place for any unknown reason

rate 4/10
